I've seen kao on a first gen. Sendai Kunikane and on some early Hizen
pieces, but in general, kao are a rather Shin-Shinto thing.

Gordon
----------
From: "Richard Turner" <ikkanshi@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: [nihontostudy] Mei with Kao
Date: Mon, 28 Apr 2003 19:55:55 +0800


Hi all, I was flicking through 4 Aito ( I think this is the title )
Magazines/Catalogues I recieved today and am looking at a very long
inscription that consists of  11 charactures and a Kao. I am working on the
inscription ( should keep me busy for day's ) but am wondeing, when did Kao
come into use on Sword mei ?, was this a Shinto or Shinshinto thing ? or did
it happen in the earlier periods ?.

This sword is dated ???? ????  the 4th year of Bunsei ( 1821 ) I will have
to work on the front section, I assume it is a month or something. The mei
will take a lot longer :-)

cheers all

Rich
